Activate Two-Factor Authentication to en: Activate Two-Factor Authentication to enable this block.
Activate Two-Factor Authentication and o: Activate Two-Factor Authentication and one method to enable this block.
You have enforced 2FA, but not configure: You have enforced 2FA, but not configured any methods for the role:
You have enforced 2FA, but not configured any methods.
File changes have been been reset: File changes have been been reset
Here you can add IP addresses that shoul: Here you can add IP addresses that should never be blocked by region restrictions.
Restrict access from specific countries: Restrict access from specific countries or continents. You can also allow only specific countries.
Activate Limit login attempts to enable: Activate Limit login attempts to enable this block.
All notifications are triggered successf: All notifications are triggered successfully, please check your email to double-check if you can receive emails.
You have not enabled the email notificat: You have not enabled the email notifications in the general settings.
The notification test only works if you: The notification test only works if you save the setting first.
Activate vulnerability detection to enab: Activate vulnerability detection to enable this block.
Collecting plugin, theme and core data: Collecting plugin, theme and core data
Isolates the plugin or theme if no updat: Isolates the plugin or theme if no update can be performed
Force update the plugin or theme: Force update the plugin or theme
Include 6 Tips & Tricks to get started w: Include 6 Tips & Tricks to get started with Really Simple Security.
Redirect to this post when someone tries: Redirect to this post when someone tries to access /wp-admin or /wp-login.php. The default is a 404 page.
%s cannot be implemented due to server l: %s cannot be implemented due to server limitations. Check your notices for the detected issue.
Enable Learning Mode to configure automa: Enable Learning Mode to configure automatically
The %s is now in report-only mode and w: The %s is now in report-only mode and will collect directives. This might take a while. Afterwards you can Exit, Edit and Enforce these Directives.
The Permissions Policy has been disabled: The Permissions Policy has been disabled.
Permissions Policy is set outside Really: Permissions Policy is set outside Really Simple Security.
%s is already set outside Really Simple: %s is already set outside Really Simple Security.
By placing it outside the root folder, i: By placing it outside the root folder, it is not publicly accessible.
Everything is now served over SSL: Everything is now served over SSL
No results. Start your first scan: No results. Start your first scan
Review the settings and enforce the poli: Review the settings and enforce the policy
This feature is only available networkwi: This feature is only available networkwide.
The certificate is not generated by Real: The certificate is not generated by Really Simple Security, so there are no installation files here
DNS verification active. You can switch: DNS verification active. You can switch back to directory verification here.
The CA Bundle will sometimes be automati: The CA Bundle will sometimes be automatically detected. If not, you can use this file.
The private key can be uploaded or paste: The private key can be uploaded or pasted in the appropriate field on your hosting dashboard.
This is the certificate, which you need: This is the certificate, which you need to install in your hosting dashboard.
If you're sure it's set correctly, you c: If you're sure it's set correctly, you can click the button to skip the DNS check.
You can manually check the DNS records i: You can manually check the DNS records in an %sonline tool%s.
We could not check the DNS records. If y: We could not check the DNS records. If you just added the record, please check in a few minutes.
Add the following token as text record t: Add the following token as text record to your DNS records. We recommend to use a short TTL during installation, in case you need to change it.
Inside the folder called \u201cssl\u201d: Inside the folder called “ssl” create a new folder called “certs”, with 644 writing permissions.
The certificate will get stored in this: The certificate will get stored in this directory.
Inside the folder called \u201cssl\u201d: Inside the folder called “ssl” create a new folder called “keys”, with 644 writing permissions.
Navigate in FTP or File Manager to one l: Navigate in FTP or File Manager to one level above the root of your WordPress installation:
The key directory is needed to store the: The key directory is needed to store the generated keys.
If the challenge directory cannot be cre: If the challenge directory cannot be created, you can either remove the server limitation, or change to DNS verification.
Or you can switch to DNS verification: Or you can switch to DNS verification
Inside the folder called \u201c.well-kno: Inside the folder called “.well-known” create a new folder called “acme-challenge”, with 644 writing permissions.
Navigate in FTP or File Manager to the r: Navigate in FTP or File Manager to the root of your WordPress installation:
The challenge directory is used to verif: The challenge directory is used to verify the domain ownership.
If the challenge directory cannot be cre: If the challenge directory cannot be created, or is not reachable, you can either remove the server limitation, or change to DNS verification.
Please note that auto-renewal with a DNS: Please note that auto-renewal with a DNS challenge might not be possible.
If you also want to secure subdomains li: If you also want to secure subdomains like mail.domain.com, cpanel.domain.com, you have to use the %sDNS%s challenge.
